Dear all.
In our system, which embeds Heritrix,
We have problems using our =
own queue-assignment-policy.

We get the following error:
Nov 22, 2005 3:23=
:34 PM
org.archive.crawler.settings.CrawlSettingsSAXHandler 
handleValueErr=
or
WARNING: Value not in legal values list
 Attribute: 'frontier:queue-assi=
gnment-policy'
 Value:     'org.archive.crawler.frontier.DomainnameQueueAss=
ignmentPolicy'
 
File:     
'file:/home/netarkiv/TEST1/harvester_8081/4_113=
2669413098/order.xml',
 line: 114, column: 115

It is not clear to me, if t=
he heritrix.properties is read anywhere
implicitly in our (as we don't use =
the Heritrix.java class, but
instead instantiate a CrawlController, and use=
 this to crawl).
The Heritrix.java class seems to me the only class, which =
loads the
heritrix.properties.

  
And if it is, which heritrix.properties =
is supposed to be read.
I can see two possible default locations for the he=
ritrix.properties:
1) Inside the heritrix.jar
2) In the conf/ directory



=
